00023     MelFilter::MelFilter(double sampleFrequency):
00024         sampFreq(sampleFrequency), enabled(true)
00025     {
00026     }

00035     void MelFilter::createFilter(unsigned short filterNum,
00036                                  unsigned short melFilterWidth, unsigned int N)
00037     {
00038         // calculating frequencies in Mel scale
00039         double melMinFreq = filterNum * melFilterWidth / 2.0;
00040         double melCenterFreq = melMinFreq + melFilterWidth / 2.0;
00041         double melMaxFreq = melMinFreq + melFilterWidth;
00042 
00043         // converting them to linear
00044         double minFreq = melToLinear(melMinFreq);
00045         double centerFreq = melToLinear(melCenterFreq);
00046         double maxFreq = melToLinear(melMaxFreq);
00047 
00048         // generating spectrum in linear scale
00049         generateFilterSpectrum(minFreq, centerFreq, maxFreq, N);
00050     }
00051 
00060     double MelFilter::apply(const spectrumType& dataSpectrum,
00061                             unsigned int N) const
00062     {
00063         double value = 0.0;
00064         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < N / 2 - 1; ++i)
00065             value += std::abs(dataSpectrum[i]) * filterSpectrum[i];
00066         return value;
00067     }
00068 
00077     void MelFilter::generateFilterSpectrum(double minFreq, double centerFreq,
00078                                            double maxFreq, unsigned int N)
00079     {
00080         filterSpectrum.clear();
00081         filterSpectrum.resize(N);
00082 
00083         // scale the frequencies according to spectrum size
00084         minFreq *= N / sampFreq;
00085         centerFreq *= N / sampFreq;
00086         maxFreq *= N / sampFreq;
00087 
00088 
00089         // maximum and current value of the filter spectrum
00090         double max = 1.0, value;
00091 
00092         for (unsigned int k = 0; k < N; ++k)
00093         {
00094             // outside the triangle spectrum has 0 values
00095             if (k < minFreq || k > maxFreq)
00096             {
00097                 value = 0.0;
00098             }
00099             else
00100             {
00101                 // in the triangle, on the ascending slope
00102                 if (k < centerFreq)
00103                 {
00104                     value = k * max / (centerFreq - minFreq) -
00105                         minFreq * max / (centerFreq - minFreq);
00106                 }
00107                 // in the triangle, on the descending slope
00108                 else
00109                 {
00110                     value = k * max / (centerFreq - maxFreq) -
00111                         maxFreq * max / (centerFreq - maxFreq);
00112                 }
00113             }
00114 
00115             filterSpectrum[k] = value;
00116         }
00117     }
00118 }
